meanings.definition: Making or characterized by a loud and insistent outcry.
meanings.sent1: The vociferous crowd cheered loudly at the game.
meanings.sent2: She was known for her vociferous protests against injustice.
meanings.sent3: The vociferous parrot in the pet store entertained the customers with its loud squawks.
meanings.sent4: The storm was so vociferous, it drowned out all other sounds.
meanings.sent5: The vociferous alarm blared, waking up the entire neighborhood.

meanings.definition: Expressing feelings or opinions in a very loud or forceful way.
meanings.sent1: The vociferous child demanded attention with his loud complaints.
meanings.sent2: The politician was vociferous in his criticism of the new policy.
meanings.sent3: The vociferous cat meowed loudly for its favorite treat.
meanings.sent4: Her vociferous laughter filled the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The vociferous debate echoed through the halls of the school.
